markdown:
<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Redact](/Spells.aspx?ID=2391)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Divine Mysteries](/Sources.aspx?ID=234) pg. 266

**Domain**
[Glyph](/Domains.aspx?ID=109)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** unattended written materials of up to 1 Bulk
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 day
</row>

</column>

---

You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents. When you [Cast the Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=2734), give one proper name, be it a creature, location, or object. Any mention of that name within the document becomes blurred, smudged, or otherwise completely illegible. Epithets and unambiguous references to the name are redacted as well; for instance, redacting the name of the goddess [Sarenrae](/Deities.aspx?ID=292) from a book would also remove references to her title “the Dawnflower.” Attempts to use this reference material to [Recall Knowledge](/Rules.aspx?ID=2638) about the given proper name automatically fail.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** Instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or Society check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn’t tell them what the original said.

**Heightened (4th)** At your choice, the duration is unlimited.
name: Redact
